abstract.text: A structure that contains the location and dimensions of a rectangle.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: In the default Core Graphics coordinate space, the origin is located in the lower-left corner of the rectangle and the rectangle extends towards the upper-right corner. If the context has a flipped-coordinate space—often the case on iOS—the origin is in the upper-left corner and the rectangle extends towards the lower-right corner.

abstract.text: An affine transformation matrix for use in drawing 2D graphics.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
A structure that contains a point in a two-dimensional coordinate system.

A structure that contains a two-dimensional vector.
Returns the largest value for the y-coordinate of the rectangle.
Returns whether the first rectangle contains the second rectangle.
Returns a rectangle that is smaller or larger than the source rectangle, with the same center point.

Returns a rectangle with an origin that is offset from that of the source rectangle.

Returns whether a rectangle is infinite.
Returns the intersection of two rectangles.
Returns whether the rectangle is equal to the null rectangle.
Returns the height of a rectangle.
Returns a dictionary representation of the provided rectangle.
Returns the smallest rectangle that contains the two source rectangles.

Returns the smallest value for the x-coordinate of the rectangle.
Returns the x- coordinate that establishes the center of a rectangle.

Returns whether two rectangles are equal in size and position.

values.
